definition: to sprint/to spurt/to dash/big effort
powerful/vigorous/pungent/towards/in view of
thoroughfare/to go straight ahead/to rush/to clash
(of water) to dash against/to mix with water/to infuse/to rinse/to flush/to develop (a film)/to rise in the air/to clash/to collide with
(onom.) whoosh
thorn/sting/thrust/to prick/to pierce/to stab/to assassinate/to murder

sentences.english: Stop, breathe for a sec, then sprint again.
sentences.chinese: 停下来，呼吸几秒，然后再冲刺。

sentences.english: The runner kept some energy in store for spurting at the end.
sentences.chinese: 那名赛跑的人为最后的冲刺贮存精力。

sentences.english: We sought to parry the charateristic soviet lunge with fancy footwork.
sentences.chinese: 我们以花式步法力图避开典型的苏联冲刺。

sentences.english: Lynx have longer legs and much broader paws. This helps them charge around in snow.
sentences.chinese: 山猫腿较长，脚掌较宽，协助它们在雪地中冲刺。

sentences.english: The peak phase is characterized by short, fast workouts that simulate racing.
sentences.chinese: 冲刺阶段的特征是短而快的训练，这是为了模拟比赛。

sentences.english: Collecting my energy for one last push, I was eating a chocolate bar when along pedalled two 15-year-olds.
sentences.chinese: 为了积蓄能量做最后冲刺，我吃了一块巧克力。

sentences.english: This list of tasks becomes the Sprint Backlog.
sentences.chinese: 任务的列表就成了所谓的代办冲刺。

sentences.english: The runner seemed to be rallying for a final sprint.
sentences.chinese: 赛跑者似乎在振作精神作最后冲刺。

sentences.english: The two knights tilted at each other on horseback.
sentences.chinese: 两个骑士骑马持长矛互相冲刺。

sentences.english: The odor of disinfectant stung my nostrils as I moved down the row of pens.
sentences.chinese: 下楼梯时消毒水的味道冲刺着我的鼻孔。

sentences.english: Try it: go outside and sprint all-out for two minutes.
sentences.chinese: 试试吧，走到外面，竭尽全力地冲刺两分钟。

sentences.english: He sprinted past the other runners just before reaching the tape.
sentences.chinese: 他在到达终点之前全速冲刺，超越了其他赛跑者。

sentences.english: Sprints shall be run according to the rules governing sprint races.
sentences.chinese: 运动员的冲刺，以争先赛的有关规则为准。

sentences.english: I got the book-writing done by breaking it down into hour-long sprints.
sentences.chinese: 而这本书的完成我是以每小时为单位做写作冲刺的。

sentences.english: The product owner and team agree on a goal for the sprint.
sentences.chinese: 产品所有者和团队会就冲刺阶段的目标达成一致意见。

sentences.english: Hurdling is something that involves my whole body being stretched and contorted in quick bursts.
sentences.chinese: 跨栏赛跑需要在快速的冲刺中拉伸和扭曲整个身体。

definition: sudden and violent attack/assault/fig. rushed job/concentrated effort to finish a job quickly
to go at full throttle/(fig.) to go all out/to kick into high gear
to run
to increase the specified cruising speed/to pick up speed/to speed up
to wait for action after having accumulated power, energy etc
to run up (pole vault, javelin, bowling etc)/approach/run-up/(aviation) takeoff run
to start running/the start of a race
to charge forward
to press on towards/to close in on/to approach/to draw near
target/goal/objective/CL:個|个[ge4]
to go forward/to forge ahead/to advance/onward
to assault a fortified position/(fig.) to concentrate one's efforts on a particularly difficult part of one's mission
to advance courageously (idiom)/to press forward
to dash (run fast)/to rush/to dart
in a spurt of energy
forward/onward
